public TextField()
Creates a new TextField of a default size of 250 x 50 with black letters on white background.

TextField

public TextField(int width,
                 int height)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new TextField of the given size with black letters on white background.

Parameters:
width - The TextFields width (which has to be greater than 50).
height - The TextFields height (which has to be greater than 20).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

TextField

public TextField(int width,
                 int height,
                 boolean enabled)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new TextField of the given size with black letters on white background.

Parameters:
width - The TextFields width (which has to be greater than 50).
height - The TextFields height (which has to be greater than 20).
enabled - If you want the textfield to be enabled (able to write in it) this boolean has to be true.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

TextField

public TextField(int width,
                 int height,
                 boolean displayKeyNames,
                 boolean enabled,
                 java.awt.Color bgColor,
                 java.awt.Color textColor,
                 java.lang.String text)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new TextField of the given size, the given colors and a starting text.

Parameters:
width - The TextFields width (which has to be greater than 50).
height - The TextFields height (which has to be greater than 20).
displayKeyNames - If you want to use the textfield for only one key this parameter has to be true.
enabled - If you want the textfield to be enabled (able to write in it) this boolean has to be true.
bgColor - The color of the TextFields background.
textColor - The color of the text.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
